component.text: Match each type of TCP/IP attack to its description. Not all attack types will be used.
You have successfully matched each TCP/IP attack type to its description.
You have not successfully matched each TCP/IP attack type to its description. Please click Reset to try again.
An attacker intercepts communications between computers to steal information transiting through the network.
Type of attack that creates a large amount of requests from a single source, aiming to overwhelm the destination device.
A computer uses a forged IP or MAC address to pretend to be a trusted computer to gain access to resources.
Data transmissions are intercepted and recorded by an attacker. They are then sent to the destination computer. The destination computer handles these transmissions as though they are authentic.
This attack randomly opens TCP ports at the source of the attack with a large amount of false SYN requests. This causes sessions to be denied to others.
